1. <p>ba7b
 Carbonic acid and its conjugate base, carbonate, is also known as respiratory acid as it is the only acid excreted as a gas by the lungs.
Carbonic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 6.35 and 10.33 .
Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂CO₃ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

13. <p>e651
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 


14. <p>dca8

- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

19. <p>6c81
 Malic acid and its conjugate base, malate, is the main acid in many fruits and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Malic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.40 and 5.20 .
Malic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

27. <p>af3e
 Oxalic acid and its conjugate base, oxalate, is found in many plants and vegetables and is a product of metabolic processes.
Oxalic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.27 and 4.28 .
Oxalic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)₂²⁻

35. <p>940b
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

41. <p>60af
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 8.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻

 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

- [ ] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

- [ ] C. H₂CO₃

- [ ] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] C. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

Oxalic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.27 and 4.28 .

- [ ] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] A. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 3.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

- [*] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 5.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂CO₃ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

Uric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 5.40 and 10.30 .
Uric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [*] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

1069. <p>f454

Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 7.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂ 


1097. <p>4a83
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] A. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

1201. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [*] C. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 3.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] A. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH 
- [*] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

- [ ] A. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

Oxalic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 5.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)₂

1619. <p>940b
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

1663. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 7.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂CO₃

Uric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 5.40 and 10.30 .
Uric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

1783. <p>4223
 Carbonic acid and its conjugate base, carbonate, is also known as respiratory acid as it is the only acid excreted as a gas by the lungs.
Carbonic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 6.35 and 10.33 .
Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂CO₃

1795. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

1817. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

1823. <p>60af
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

1861. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

Oxalic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)₂

1927. <p>e651

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 


1928. <p>dca8
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

Uric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 5.40 and 10.30 .
Uric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 12.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. C₅H₄N₄O₃ 
- [ ] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [*] C. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂CO₃ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

1993. <p>e651

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

2021. <p>60af
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 8.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

2059. <p>e651

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂ 


2084. <p>a0b2

Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.

- [*] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻

- [ ] A. H₂CO₃ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. CO₃²⁻

Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 5.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂CO₃

Uric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

2509. <p>4223
 Carbonic acid and its conjugate base, carbonate, is also known as respiratory acid as it is the only acid excreted as a gas by the lungs.
Carbonic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 6.35 and 10.33 .
Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂CO₃

2521. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

2543. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

2549. <p>60af
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃ 


2550. <p>922b
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

- [ ] A. (COO)₂²⁻ 
- [*] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)₂

- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂CO₃

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 8.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. SO₃²⁻ 


2759. <p>9662

- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.

- [*] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

Malic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.40 and 5.20 .
Malic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)₂²⁻

2873. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

2879. <p>60af
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

2905. <p>4223
 Carbonic acid and its conjugate base, carbonate, is also known as respiratory acid as it is the only acid excreted as a gas by the lungs.

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂CO₃

- [*] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂CO₃

- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

Oxalic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.27 and 4.28 .
Oxalic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COO)₂²⁻ 


3071. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

3115. <p>e651
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

 Malic acid and its conjugate base, malate, is the main acid in many fruits and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Malic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.40 and 5.20 .
Malic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

- [*] C. (COOH)₂

 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.

Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

3143. <p>4a83
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 8.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂CO₃

- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

Oxalic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [*] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)₂²⁻

3335. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.

Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

3379. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

3433. <p>4223
 Carbonic acid and its conjugate base, carbonate, is also known as respiratory acid as it is the only acid excreted as a gas by the lungs.
Carbonic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 6.35 and 10.33 .
Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.

- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻

Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 8.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

- [*] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

- [ ] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

- [ ] A. H₂CO₃ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. CO₃²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 5.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)₂

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻

- [ ] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

- [*] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

Oxalic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.27 and 4.28 .
Oxalic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 3.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)₂²⁻ 
- [*] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)₂

4061. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

4067. <p>60af
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂CO₃

4105. <p>e651
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

4109. <p>391c

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

- [*] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

- [*] C. CO₃²⁻

- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

4523. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

- [ ] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

- [ ] C. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻

Oxalic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.27 and 4.28 .
Oxalic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 3.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [*] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)₂²⁻

4787. <p>940b

Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

4831. <p>e651
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

Carbonic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 6.35 and 10.33 .
Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 5.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂CO₃ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

4897. <p>e651
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 7.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 


4991. <p>4a83

Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .

- [*] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 7.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

5095. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 3.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

Malic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH 
- [*] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

5315. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

5321. <p>4a83
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂CO₃

- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂CO₃

Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 3.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [*] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 6.0 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

- [*] C. H₂CO₃

- [ ] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

5821. <p>e651
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 


5822. <p>cead

- [ ] A. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH)

Uric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 11.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₄N₄O₃

- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] C. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

Malic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.40 and 5.20 .
Malic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻ 
- [*] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻

- [*] A. (COOH)₂ 
- [ ] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)₂²⁻

6041. <p>732a
 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.
Succinic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 4.20 and 5.60 .
Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (CH₂)₂(COO)₂²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

6047. <p>4a83
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. H₂SO₃ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻

6073. <p>4223
 Carbonic acid and its conjugate base, carbonate, is also known as respiratory acid as it is the only acid excreted as a gas by the lungs.

Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 4.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. CO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂CO₃

- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂CO₃

Uric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 5.40 and 10.30 .
Uric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 8.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. C₅H₄N₄O₃ 
- [*] B. C₅H₃N₄O₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻

6151. <p>f454

Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .

- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [*] C. H₂SO₃

- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [*] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. H₂SO₃

 Malic acid and its conjugate base, malate, is the main acid in many fruits and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Malic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.40 and 5.20 .
Malic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)CH₂CH(OH)COO²⁻ 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COO⁻ 
- [*] C. (COOH)CH₂CH(OH)COOH

 Succinic acid and its conjugate base, succinate, is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle and can act as a signaling molecule reflecting the cellular metabolic state.

Succinic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.5 ?</p>

- [ ] B. (CH₂)₂(COOH)(COO)⁻ 
- [*] C. (CH₂)₂(COOH)₂

6311. <p>60af
 Sulfurous acid and its conjugate base, sulfite, occurs naturally in wine, but larger amounts are added to wine to stop fermentation and prevent spoilage.
Sulfurous acid is diprotic with pKa values of 1.81 and 6.97 .
Sulfurous acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 0.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. SO₃²⁻ 
- [ ] B. HSO₃⁻ 
- [*] C. H₂SO₃

Carbonic acid is diprotic with pKa values of 6.35 and 10.33 .
Carbonic acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 7.5 ?</p>
- [ ] A. H₂CO₃ 
- [*] B. HCO₃⁻ 
- [ ] C. CO₃²⁻

6349. <p>f454
 Fumaric acid and its conjugate base, fumarate, is produced by human skin when exposed to sunlight and is an intermediate in the citric acid cycle.
Fumaric acid is diprotic with pKa values of 3.03 and 4.44 .
Fumaric acid has three possible protonation states in the choices below.
Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 1.5 ?</p>
- [*] A. (COOH)CH=CH(COOH) 
- [ ] B. (COOH)CH=CH(COO)⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COO)CH=CH(COO)²⁻

- [ ] C. C₅H₂N₄O₃²⁻

Which one of the following protonation states is the most abundant at pH 2.0 ?</p>
- [ ] A. (COO)₂²⁻ 
- [*] B. (HOOC)COO⁻ 
- [ ] C. (COOH)₂

- [ ] C. SO₃²⁻
